fr.upmc.components.connectors

Interface DataTwoWayConnectorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, ConnectorI, DataTwoWayI.PullI, DataTwoWayI.PushI, OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI, TwoWayConnectorI, TwoWayI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataTwoWayConnector, DataTwoWayConnector

    public interface DataTwoWayConnectorI
extends TwoWayConnectorI, DataTwoWayI.PullI, DataTwoWayI.PushI
    The interface DataTwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others, but using the same interface on both sides and act as peers in the exchange.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2012-01-23

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      translates data as defined by the first two way interface into data as defined in the second two way interface.

      translates data as defined by the second two way interface into data as defined in the first two way interface.

    • Method Detail

      • second2first

        DataTwoWayI.DataI second2first(DataTwoWayI.DataI d)
        translates data as defined by the second two way interface into data as defined in the first two way interface.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   d == null && return == null || d != null && return != null
        Parameters:
        d - data to be translated
        Returns:
        data resulting from the translation

      • first2second

        DataTwoWayI.DataI first2second(DataTwoWayI.DataI d)
        translates data as defined by the first two way interface into data as defined in the second two way interface.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   d == null && return == null || d != null && return != null
        Parameters:
        d - data to be translated
        Returns:
        data resulting from the translation
